subject: Self Care
title: Toxic Work Culture
description: A 60-second lesson on Toxic Work Culture.

hook.text: MIT research found that toxic culture is 10 times more predictive of attrition than compensation. Culture kills quietly.

buildup.text: Toxic cultures include: disrespect, exclusion, unethical behavior, ruthless competition, and abusive management.

discovery.text: In toxic environments, people spend energy on self-protection instead of productive work. Burnout accelerates.

twist.text: Some toxic cultures disguise themselves as high-performance. 'We work hard, play hard' often means 'We burn out and celebrate it.'

climax.text: Recognize the signs: high turnover, fear-based management, and silence around problems. Then decide with clear eyes.

punchline.text: Toxic culture is the top quit-driver. Trust the red flags.

quiz.question: How much more predictive is toxic culture than compensation for employee attrition?
